page.title: 08TRANSPORT
page.content: There is no regular public transport service in Laurieston, so the Post Bus serves the community, each day taking passengers to the nearby town of Castle Douglas, 6 miles away. The Post Bus has been running for approximately 7 years. It runs on all days exept Sundays and half days on Saturdays. There are a few regular passengers, on average 3 to 4 people on all days except Fridays, when there are slightly more.The route is from Mossdale to Castle Douglas by the main road. In the summer there is a scenic route taking in small farms around the Balmaghie area. The cost from Mossdale to Castle Douglas, approximately 10 miles, is 74p. Of the approximately 80 inhabitants of Laurieston,40 have their own cars,allowing them to commute more easily to nearby towns.
